byline.contributor: Doris Burke contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: With iPhone sales projected to decelerate, investors will be scouring Apple’s earnings report on Tuesday for signs of how fast the company’s downshift is happening.

headline.print_headline: Searching for Signs of Slowing at Apple
headline.main: Looking for Signs That Apple’s Runaway Growth Is Waning

snippet: With iPhone sales projected to decelerate, investors will be scouring Apple’s earnings report on Tuesday for signs of how fast the company’s downshift is happening.
abstract: Investors are starting to look at Apple as 'value' stock rather than growth stock, which often have far lower valuations; company's record of 50 or 60 percent annual growth may be fading; investors will closely peruse new earnings report.
